cai_variables.description: (In-game) Base chance per round that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance).
(In-game) Additional per round chance that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance).
(In-game) Whether the aggression ramp is enable. 0=no, 1=yes
(In-game) Player fame level at which the ramp ends and the maximum level of aggression will be applied.
(In-game) Player fame level beyond which the aggression ramp will start to apply.
(In-game) The ending level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. Should be equal to or greater than the minimum level selected. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH.
(In-game) The starting level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH.
(In-game) Round at which the ramp should finish (and max level be used for aggression increases).
(In-game) Round beyond which the aggression ramp will start (beginning with the minimum aggression level).
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the starting priority used.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the round at which to start applying a priority variation.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the ending priority used.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the round at which to end applying a priority variation.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non- human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of cultural conversion options in the construction system.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of demolition options in the construction system.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of repair options in the construction system.

(In-game) Multiplier applied to region count values if climate change mitigation is in effect (CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_BUILDING_APPLY_BONUS_AT_OR_BELOW_REGION_ADJUSTMENT, CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_BUILDING_APPLY_PENALTY_BELOW_REGION_ADJUSTMENT).
(In-game) Rounds from expected climate change that AI's will start to take mitigating action.
(In-game) When considering the importance of buildings for a specific context how much should value for money count versus raw priority (0.0, not a bit to 1.0, entirely).
(In-game) In Gempei targetting and diplomatic adjustments the number of regions a minor faction must own before being considered major.
(In-game) Within the AI construction system the proportion of value for money evaluation that should be applied.
(In-game) In the construction system the target value used when adjusting a buildings evaluation due to value of money effects.
(In-game) Multiplier for strength of major factions.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Controls for diplomatic effects of some dilemmas.
(In-game) Distance-based modifier for diplomatic goals.
(In-game) Set it to 1 if you dare. DO NOT SET IT ANY HIGHER!!!
(In-game) In using the emergency unit culling mechanics what percentage of elligable units should be disbanded to mitigate the problem.
(In-game) In making use of the emergency unit culling mechanics what multiplier should be allied to the factions corresponding zero_or_negative_net_income_survival_rounds value.
(In-game) Enables CAI faction controller management.
(In-game) Specifies the CAI faction controller management threshold.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, easy difficulty, levels to apply at.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias,easy difficulty, rounds to apply for.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, hard difficulty, levels to apply at.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, hard difficulty, rounds to apply for.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, legendary difficulty, levels to apply at.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, legendary difficulty, rounds to apply for.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, normal difficulty, levels to apply at.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, normal difficulty, rounds to apply for.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, very hard difficulty, levels to apply at.
(In-game) CAI Budgeting bias, very hard difficulty, rounds to apply for.
(In-game) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the adjustment applied against the desire of a major clan to aid a minor clan ally when being attacked or attacking.
(In-game) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the adjustment applied against the desire of a major clan allying with a minor clan.
(In-game) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the weighing multiplier applied for a major clan joining a war against a minor clan at the request of a minor clan.
(In-game) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to food producgin buildings.
(In-game) Adjustment to the food penalty thresholds based on number of regions owned by a faction.
(In-game) The point below which a food penalty will be applied to a building option.
(In-game) Adjustment to the food penalty thresholds based on number of regions owned by a faction.
(In-game) Bonus applied (per food point) for buildings that increase food up to the specified level.
(In-game) When calculating food based building score adjustements, the discount applied for being a new building.
(In-game) Penalty applied (per food point) for buildings that use food beyond the specified level.
(In-game) Score at or above which the ongoing food detection system will start allowing building conversion to solve the problem.
(In-game) Per region based adjustment to CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_ONGOING_PROBLEM_CONVERSION_THRESHOLD_BASIC.
(In-game) Score at or above which the ongoing food detection system will start allowing building demolition to solve the problem.
(In-game) Per region based adjustment to CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_ONGOING_PROBLEM_DEMOLITION_THRESHOLD_BASIC.
(In-game) When accruing score for the ongoing food problem detection system the cap applied to the amount being added to the score.
(In-game) AI strength bonus for fortified settlements.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements.
(In-game) Reduction of fortification bonus for each siege engine present.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements used for threat detection.
(In-game) Modifier for enemy strength in threat calculations. Cannot be 0.
(In-game) When adding a horde to an existing group the number of hordes to split from the group (excluding the new horde) to use in forming a new horde group.
(In-game) Maximum size of a horde group.
(In-game) Maximum acceptable distance from a horde to consider membership - multiplier on the median bordering inter-region distance.
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude bonus towards the AI.
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude bonus towards the player.
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude penalty towards the AI.
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude penalty towards the player.
(In-game) AI will receive a bonus to onfederating when the resulting faction would be under this proportion of human strength.
(In-game) Maximum number of goals evaluated by each faction per round.
(In-game) Maximum number of goals evaluated by all factions per round.
(In-game) Number of siege engines required before rebels assault a highest level fortified settlement.
(In-game) Probability of migration at the lower threshold.
(In-game) Probability of migration at and beyond the upper threshold.
(In-game) Lower threshold for enemy strength for migration. Expressed as a multiple of our strength.
(In-game) Upper threshold for enemy strength for migration. Expressed as a multiple of our strength.
(In-game) Probability of migration when fertility is low.
(In-game) Fertility level below which migration will be considered.
(In-game) Hordes below that attitude will be considered a threat when deciding whether to migrate.
(In-game) Percentage chance that the AI will choose to fight you on the field for non-port, minor settlement battles.
(In-game) Number of siege engines required before rebels assault a lowest level fortified settlement.
(In-game) Weight of army strength when analyzing strength on sea.
(In-game) Weight of navy strength when analyzing strength on sea.
(In-game) Percentage chance that the AI will choose to fight you at night.
(In-game) Time in rounds beyond which specific occupation decisions information against a settlement will be forgotten.
(In-game) Upper bound for player AP deadzone adjustment for threat detection purposes.
(In-game) Lower bound for player AP deadzone adjustment for threat detection purposes.
(In-game) Upper bound for player AP adjustment for threat detection purposes.
(In-game) Lower bound for player AP adjustment for threat detection purposes.
(In-game) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to public order improvement buildings.
(In-game) The point below which a public order penalty will be applied to a building option.
(In-game) Bonus applied (per public order point) for buildings that increae public order up to the specified level.
(In-game) When calculating public order based building score adjustements, the discount applied for being a new building.
(In-game) Penalty applied (per public order point) for buildings that use public order beyond the specified level.
(In-game) The public order problem score for a province beyond which conversion is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The public order problem score for a province beyond which demolition is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The maximum public order problem score that can be accumulated in one round for a given province.
(In-game) Limits the rebel unit quality to (([sum of building levels in region] * multiplier) + offset) * [quality of best recruitable unit in faction province].
(In-game) Limits the rebel unit quality to (([sum of building levels in region] * multiplier) + offset) * [quality of best recruitable unit in faction province].
(In-game) In the case that an additional rebellion would trigger in a region with an existing rebellion, by how much should that existing rebellions attack time out be adjusted. Maximum adjustment.
(In-game) In the case that an additional rebellion would trigger in a region with an existing rebellion, by how much should that existing rebellions attack time out be adjusted. Minimum adjustment.
(In-game) Maximum timeout used for a rebel faction before it should consider an arbitrary attack.
(In-game) Minimum timeout used for a rebel faction before it should consider an arbitrary attack.
(In-game) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (easy difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (easy difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (easy difficulty).
(In-game) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (hard difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (hardl difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (hard difficulty).
(In-game) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (normal difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (normal difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (normal difficulty).
(In-game) Above zero, allows AI to consider retreat versus another AI.
(In-game) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (very hard difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (very hard difficulty).
(In-game) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (very hard difficulty).
(In-game) Modifier for own strength in safe path calculations.
(In-game) Percentage chance that the AI will choose to fight you at night for settlement battles.
(In-game) Personality-based modifier for assaulting settlements.
(In-game) Personality-based modifier for defending settlements.
(In-game) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to squalor/sanitation improvement buildings.
(In-game) The point below which a squalor/sanitation penalty will be applied to a building option.
(In-game) Bonus applied (per positive squalor/sanitation point) for buildings that increase squalor/sanitation up to the specified level.
(In-game) When calculating squalor/sanitation based building score adjustements, the discount applied for being a new building.
(In-game) Penalty applied (per negative squalor/sanitation point) for buildings that use squalor/sanitation beyond the specified level.
(In-game) The squalor/sanitation problem score for a province beyond which conversion is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The squalor/sanitation problem score for a province beyond which demolition is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The maximum squalor/sanitation problem score that can be accumulated in one round for a given province.
(In-game) Parameter for strategic balance calculation.
(In-game) Parameter for strategic balance calculation.
(In-game) Parameter for strategic balance calculation.
(In-game) Parameter for strategic balance calculation.
(In-game) Adjustment to strategic balance is applied for every X enemies.
(In-game) Adjustment to strategic balance applied for the purpose of strategic context calculations.
(In-game) Strategic stance system control, provides the limit on the 'existing stances' bonus to a given stance group.
(In-game) Strategic stance system control, current attitude adjustment factor reliability multipler.
(In-game) Strategic stance system control, the bias provided towards the friendly stance in the subjugation case.
(In-game) Strategic stance system control, the drop rate from friendly.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of being human.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of current and historical attitude.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of basic treaties.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of transitive effects between factions based on basic treaties.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of existing faction stance.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of 'importance'.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of subjugation.
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of task generation (types and targets).
(In-game) Strategic stance system score weighting, impact of treacheries.
(In-game) Time horizon in rounds beyond which a 'complex' treachery won't be detected.
(In-game) Maximum rate of per event drop of for treachery events. Actually drop of moderated by number of current treachery events.
(In-game) Number of turns faction will ignore settlements after sacking it. 0 = ignore for the current turn only.
(In-game) AI strength bonus for unfortified settlements.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for unfortified settlements.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements used for threat detection.
(In-game) If value > 0 all regions in faction's provinces will be added to victory condition regions when the game starts or faction re-emerges.
(In-game) Minimum number of extra victory regions to be selected at random at campaign start.
(In-game) Minimum starting fertility of randomly selected victory regions.
(In-game) Minimum number of victory regions for each faction. Extra regions will be selected at random at campaign start.
(In-game) Used for the cap of waags with respect to their parents. Between 0 and 1, 1 indicates the cap will be higher.
